settings.text:
Shopping online sucks, and Eugene, Oregon's best options for men's clothing were a Nordstrom (Rack) and J Crew (Mercantile). Porterhouse Clothing & Supply was founded to give the men of Eugene a better option.

You deserve better than fast-fashion department stores, outlet malls, and overpriced suit stores. Porterhouse is here to connect men to the brands out there doing it right.

Shop Porterhouse for brands creating classic, durable and versatile products.

settings.title: A Reliable Core
settings.text:
The heart of Porterhouse is menswear. We curate options core-first, helping our customers build a wardrobe that starts with well-built basics that won't go out of style. Selvedge denim, heavyweight tees and henleys, and well-built, solid-colored button-downs.

Shop Core Styles

settings.title: Seasonal Accents
settings.text:
Layered on top of our core goods come seasonal releases from each of our brands, prepping you for varying temps and adding a little flair to your wardrobe.

While the offerings swap out each season, anything you pick up should stay in style as long as it holds up.

Shop Autumn/Winter 2021

settings.title: Finishing Touches
settings.text:
Finally, we carry the accessories, grooming products and home goods to top off your dapper lifestyle. Boots, hats, gloves and ties to finish any outfit, shave goods and cologne to keep you fresh, and candles to make sure your home is welcoming to any and all guests.

Shop Accessories

settings.title: Visiting Porterhouse at the Quackenbush
settings.text:
Porterhouse Clothing is located in downtown Eugene, Oregon. Squarely in the Broadway & Pearl shopping district, we call the historic Quackenbush Hardware store our home.

Free customer parking is available behind the building off of Broadway Alley. Head South on Pearl from Broadway and turn right in front of Dark Pine Coffee.

While you're here, be sure to visit some of our wonderful neighbors. You can find more information via the Downtown Eugene, Inc. website.
Meet Porterhouse, late live mascot at Porterhouse Clothing owner Ethan Clevenger's alma mater Drake University. Photo courtesy Drake University.
